title: Driving a heavy vehicle in the London low emission zone (LEZ)

details.description: Find out if you'll be charged for driving your heavy vehicle in Greater London, which is a Low Emission Zone (LEZ)
details.more_information:
You don't have to register on the website to [check your vehicle](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/roadusers/lez/17700.aspx "check your vehicle"){:rel="external"} or to [pay the charge.](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/roadusers/lez/17704.aspx "pay the charge"){:rel="external"} 

You can check your vehicle by type or registration number. 

##Exempt vehicles

Cars and motorcycles are exempt from the scheme. So are some light vans, specialist and historic vehicles. See the TfL website for a [list of exemptions.](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/roadusers/lez/17700.aspx#tkt-tab-panel-4 "list of vehicle exemptions"){:rel="external"}

##Vehicles to check

You'll need to check your lorry, coach, bus, minibus, service vehicle or specialist vehicle (eg motorhome or motorised horsebox).

##What to pay

Unless your vehicle is exempt, you'll need to pay a daily charge to bring it into Greater London. The TfL website lists the [current charges](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/roadusers/lez/17701.aspx#tkt-tab-panel-5 "daily LEZ charges"){:rel="external"}.

*[LEZ]: Low Emission Zone
*[TfL]: Transport for London
